column4: you can check keyserver.ubuntu.com for those keys and download them and then import them with apt-key
I tried pasting my key string...or wht I think is my key stirng in..an it says "Erroe handling request:Request hash not found"
did you start with 0x?
Error handling request. Exception raised: Failure("char out of range for hex conversion")
not sure what you are typing in to keyserver it should be 0x40976EAF437D05B5
I typed in 0x40976EAF437D05B5
http://keyserver.ubuntu.com:11371/pks/lookup?search=0x40976EAF437D05B5&op=vindex
thats what I would do. supposedly apt-key is able to query the keyserver, but i've never gotten it to work
and no you dont want all the keys on that page, you just want the ubuntu key
sorry didnt realize that was the question
ok...mind walking me through the downloading an installing it plz
so the link at the top and the one that says selfsig will take you to: http://keyserver.ubuntu.com:11371/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x40976EAF437D05B5 thats the real ascii armored key
so save the part that starts with ----BEGIN and ---END including the ---BEGIN/END lines to a file and then apt-key add filename
you are my saviour...!!....ummmm.....hw do I actually install this key?
oh ok..:) thank you!
I'm sure there is an easier way (and with anything key related you should be careful that you are getting a valid key and I'm not trying to get you to accept invalid keys)
I just copy pasted into terminal
copied and pasted the key?
well the terminal doesn't know what to do with that ascii armored key. you need to open a text editor and save that key to a file ubuntu_key.pub, and then run apt-key add /path/to/ubuntu_key.pub
ok..I did that...and the file is on my desktop...and its showing "manage apt's list of trusted keys" then a whole load of commands to do with keys
after all that all terminal has to say..is ok....lol..thank you so so so much!
